title: Bananapeel
text: After 2-5 weeks the bananapeel will be decomposed. Funfact: Bananas float in water, as do apples and watermelons.

title: Newspaper
text: After 6 weeks, the newspaper will be decomposed. Funfact: Berlingske is the oldest newspaper in Denmark, it was first released the 3th of january 1749

title: Wool Glove
text: After 6 months, the wool glove will be decomposed. Funfact: Wool is flame-resistant.

title: Cigarette butt
text: After 1-5 years, the cigarette butt will be decomposed. Funfact: Composed of cellulose acetate, a form of plastic, cigarette butts can persist in the environment as long as other forms of plastic.

title: Gum
text: After 5 years, the gum will be decomposed. Funfact: Chewing gum has also been shown to reduce muscle tension and increase alertness. Chewing gum burns around 11 calories per hour.

title: Matches
text: After 13 years, the matches will be decomposed. Funfact: Matches was discovered by mistake, when a scientist tried to rub of the chemicals and accidentally made flames

title: Plastic bag
text: After 20 years, the plastic bag will be decomposed. Funfact: Every second, 160,000 plastic bags are used around the world.

title: Batteries
text: After 100 years, the batteries and the your neighbours dead body will be decomposed. Funfact: The amount of nickel-cadmium in the average smartphone battery can pollute more than 600 thousand liters of water.

title: Soda can
text: After 200 years, the soda can will be decomposed. Funfact: It takes more energy to mine and produce aluminium than any other metal. The energy it takes to make 4 soda cans is equivalent to filling 1 of these cans with gasoline.

title: Winebottle
text: After 4000-1mil. years, the winebottle will be decomposed. Funfact: The energy saved from recycling one glass bottle can run a 100-watt light bulb for four hours. It also causes 20% less air pollution and 50% less water pollution than when a new bottle is made from raw materials.
